channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024020420
item.description:
Report E-2024020420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 10, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer floor, lift gate, wood, and asphalt ground. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and worked them in with hand tools. A hose was utilized to perform a gravity transfer to remove the remaining product from the damaged tote into a new tote provided by ER. The new tote was properly labeled and left on-site for disposal. Crews dismantled the damaged tote and impacted wooden pallet with hand tools for disposal purposes. All spent absorbents, impacted pallet, and tote were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024020821
item.description:
Report X-2024020821

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Loading the package to van contents (about a cup) leaked from seams of box. The contents that leaked were cleaned from the van and QA immediately took the package to damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: There are holes ripped on the bag and only a twist tie to close the bag. 2 Inch size holes in the bag on side of the bag. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed directly into a red hazmat tote to prevent further leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in the unload. Container is wet. Part of the contents leaked due to a loose cap. Upon discovery, I placed the package in a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: Part of the contents leaked due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery, I placed the package in a red hazmat tote.
